All of the following are requirements to become president of the U.S:
Must be a natural born U.S. citizen. Must be at least 35 years old by the time he/she will serve. Must have served at least one term in the Senate. Must have lived in the united states for at least 14 years.

In the end the thirteen colonies were: Delaware, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Georgia, Connecticut, Massachusetts Bay, Maryland, South Carolina, New Hampshire, Virginia, New York, North Carolina, and Rhode Island and Providence Plantations.
Then at war with Great Britain, the 13 colonies regarded themselves as thirteen newly independent sovereign states, and no longer a part of the British Empire.

President Abraham Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation on January 1, 1863, as the nation approached its third year of bloody civil war. The proclamation declared "that all persons held as slaves" within the rebellious states "are, and henceforward shall be free."
Lincoln warned the South in his Inaugural Address: "In your hands, my dissatisfied fellow countrymen, and not in mine, is the momentous issue of civil war.
Democracy definition. A system of government in which power is vested in the people, who rule either directly or through freely elected representatives.
